title: I updated the viewer and when I click to open up my firefox I get this message: Firefox is already running but is not responding. The old Firefox processmust be closed to open in new window. I click close over and over and nothing happens.
content: I updated the viewer and when I click to open up my firefox I get this message: Firefox is already running but is not responding. The old Firefox processmust be closed to open in new window. I click close over and over and nothing happens.
creator: anitagray56

title: Firefox Reads the Device Account Name
content: I am wanting to maximize my privacy and security on Firefox. I am using aliases to do so. However, when viewing the account settings and the connected services section, I saw that Firefox was connected to "[full legal name]'s Firefox on [laptop name]." I did not supply Firefox with my real name, and I suspect that Firefox is simply reading the name of the account I used to log into my laptop. However, changing the name of the device account is not easy as it is linked to my Microsoft account, but even after successfully doing so using the command center, the connected services still reads my real name. How do I change this?
creator: FerrousOsteon

title: Firefox sometimes restoring previous session when I open it
content:
In my settings, "Open previous windows and tabs" is not selected. And "Homepage and new windows" set to custom url.

However sometimes when I open Firefox, it's automatically restoring the previous session. I can't consistently reproduce the issue but it randomly happens after I just close the Firefox and then open it sometime later.
creator: partycat35

title: SharePoint not opening in Firefox browser
content: Why does my SharePoint and OneDrive not open in my Firefox browser? I can access Office 365 incl. word, excel, PowerPoint exc. but as soon as I login or go to SharePoint/ OneDrive after some loading time it states incorrect account. I can login with no problems on my other browsers on the same computer.
creator: jps10

title: query regarding Firefox application .
content:
we have query regarding Firefox application .

when we tried to install both 32bit and 64 bit Firefox application in 64 bit , one of the 32bit or 64 bit is getting removed from the machine.

we need a solution where both 32 bit and 64bit needs to be installed in a single 64 bit machine .so if want upgrade only 32bit , 32 bit should be upgraded with the newer version and 64 bit remains same with the version and 64 bit shouldn't be removed from the machine And when we tried to upgrade 64bit ,64 bit should be upgraded with the newer version and 32 bit remains same with the version and 64 bit shouldn't be removed from the machine.
creator: sukanya.sukkuck

title: unable to superchat
content: Recently, I've found I cannot successfully submit a superchat donation on Youtube while using Firefox. I was successful using Edge browser. Firefox asks to confirm the card number I'm using to chat, but then once acknowledged, the screen stays grey/white and doesn't ever clear to process the chat.
creator: barryfgx

title: AARP Website Won't Let Me Log In
content:
Dear Forum,

The AARP website hasn't let me log in for a few weeks. It gives the following message, and I don't know how to fix it. I looked in Firefox preferences, and AARP has all of its cookies listed. I'm not a bot, moving too quickly. I couldn't figure out whether Firefox allowed Javascript. Here is the message (but I deleted my IP and Proxy IP):


Access Denied Error 15 secure.aarp.org 2024-01-22 02:32:50 UTC What happened? This request was blocked by our security service Your IP: ___________ Proxy IP: _____ (ID _____) Incident ID: ____________

As you were browsing something about your browser made us think that you were a bot. There are few reasons this might happen: 

   You were a power user moving through this web-site with a super-human speed.    You have disabled cookies on your browser.    A third-party browser Privacy or Script OR Cookie-Blocker plugins OR Extensions OR Open/SSL/Free-Malicious VPN OR Imposter Browser Plugins -- such as Ghostery, Privacy Badger, ExpressVPN, Click&Clean, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, uBlock Origin, Blur, DuckDuckGo Privacy Essentials, Unshorten.link, NoScript, Duck-Duck-Go, Guardian and Others is preventing Javascript from running.

To regain access make sure that the cookies and javascript are enabled before loading the page.
creator: Patti-79399

title: ad blocker I don't have
content: I keep being told on certain websites to turn off my ad blocker. I don't have one. I don't even have one in the Extensions that's disabled. I have no idea how to get past this. What's turned on that I don't know about?
